results.title: Olaf Ruhen
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Videos on Australian Writers: archival writers series II”.
Researched and interviewed by James Murdoch, author Olaf Ruhen recalls a life travelling throughout Australia and the South Pacific gathering materials for his books. He speaks of his love of the sea and his affinity with the Tongan people. Ruhen recalls his friendship with the painter, Albert Namatjira. A visit to a writers’ conference in New York inspired Ruhen to create a forum for Australian authors, the Australian Society of Authors.

results.title: Oktoberfest in Munich
results.creator_credit: Joy Barrow, Barry Sloane and Barinder Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “A World of Festivals”.
Oktoberfest began in 1910 to celebrate the marriage of King Ludwig I to Princess Therese and has grown to become the world’s largest beer festival. This program provides an insight into the activities that make up the 16 day festival including the street parade featuring Munich’s brewery bands, the amusement park and the food and beer halls that cater for the 7 million annual visitors.

results.title: Oklahoma!
results.creator_credit: Arthur Hornblow, Magna Corporation, Rodgers and Hammerstein, Fred Zimmerman and Orry-Kelly
results.brief_description: Set in the Oklahoma Territory in the early 1900s “Oklahoma!” is an idealised vision of a simpler time, a story of tender romance and violent passion. With choreography by Agnes De Mille, the score is ripe with classics: “Oh, What A Beautiful Mornin’”, “The Surrey With The Fringe On Top”, “People Will Say We’re In Love” “Oaklahoma” and many more. This was the first Rodgers and Hammerstein collaboration, starting the most successful creative partnership in the history of musical theatre.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Hornblow, Magna Corporation, Rodgers and Hammerstein, Fred Zimmerman and Orry-Kelly

results.title: OK...Camera
results.creator_credit: Ian McLaren, ONF | NFB and Michael Rubbo
results.brief_description: Quebec produces many of the feature films made in Canada. The film looks at this unique, controversial industry; at the people who have succeeded in it (Genevieve Bujold is one) or failed; at its movies, which run the gamut from hard-core skinflicks to such highly acclaimed films as Mon oncle Antoine, and at its audiences, which number in the millions.

results.title: Oil: our hidden wealth
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Richard Mason
results.brief_description: Studies the search for oil in Australia, showing how oil is formed, the personnel and equipment needed in drilling a well, and how results of seismic recordings are interpreted. Describes actual drilling in Australia and Papua New Guinea.

results.title: Oil: its origin and use
results.brief_description: This video, presented in four distinct sections, is a general introduction to work in the oil industry. It shows the story of oil and gas from their origins to uses. The sections include- origin and search: shows how oil and gas originated millions of years ago and how modern scientists discover the unlikely whereabouts of underground reservoirs. Drilling: shows how an exploration well is drilled on land, and contrasts this with modern offshore developments. Refining: shows how crude oil is converted into a host of useful products through the refinery process. Distribution and use: shows how these products are distributed all over the world, and used in an endless variety of ways.
